# Komite Audit

# Audit Committee

# DASAR HUKUM

Sebagai organ pendukung di bawah Dewan Komisaris, Komite Audit dibentuk secara independen untuk membantu Dewan Komisaris dalam pemeriksaan atas penelitian terhadap fungsi Direksi dalam mengelola Perseroan. Fokusnya adalah mencatkan efektivitasugas dan fungsi pengawasan terhadap laporan keuangan serta aspek-aspek terkait dengan pengelolaan Perseroan.

Pembentukan Komite Audit Perseroan didasarkan pada peraturan POJK No. 55/POJK.04/2015 ingin Pembentukan dan Pedoman Pelaksanaan Kerja Komite Audit, seda Surat Keputusan Dewan Komisaris. Komite Audit dibentuk untuk mencatkan kualitas pemerapan governansi korporat Perseroan dan bertanggung jawab kepada Dewan Komisaris. Dalam kesehariannya, Komite Audit mematuhi Piagam Komite Audit yang disusun oleh Dewan Komisaris.

Anggota Komite Audit tidak dapat menjabat lebih lam daripada Dewan Komisaris Perseroan dan bisa dapat dipilih kembali untuk tahun ini berikutnya. Seluruh biaya operasional yang timbul dari kegiatan Komite Audit ditanggung oleh Perseroan, dan honorariumnya ditetapkan oleh Dewan Komisaris.

# LEGAL BASIS

The Audit Committee was established independently as a supporting organ of the Board of Commissioners to assist the Board of Commissioners in examining or researching the Board of Directors' role in managing the Company. The goal is to make supervisory responsibilities and functions pertaining to financial reports and company management more effective.

The establishment of the Company's Audit Committee is based on the provisions of POJK No. 55/POJK.04/2015 concerning the Establishment and Implementation Guidelines for the Audit Committee and the Decree of the Board of Commissioners. Under these provisions, the Audit Committee is established to improve the quality of the Company's corporate governance implementation by reporting to the Board of Commissioners. The Audit Committee adheres to the Audit Committee Charter prepared by the Board of Commissioners in its daily operations.

Members of the Audit Committee cannot serve longer than the Company's Board of Commissioners and can only be re-elected for one further period. All operational costs arising from the activities of the Audit Committee are borne by the Company, and the Board of Commissioners determines the honorarium.

# PIAGAM KOMITE AUDIT

Dewan Komisaris telah MEMBERujui Piagam Komite Audit pada tanggal 1 Agustus 2013. Piagam Komite Audit berisi pedomanugas, tanggung jawab, dan wewenang yang membantu Komite Audit menjalankan peranannya di Perseroan. Piagam ini memberikan panduan perkait proses pelaporan keuangan,;pemerapan governansi korporat,audit dan pengendalian internal,serta tugas-tugas lainnya.

Piagam Komite Audit mencakup aspek-aspek terkait Komite Audit dengan rincian sebagai berikut:

1. Persyaratan Keanggotaan Komite Audit  
2. Tugas dan Tanggung Jawab Komite Audit  
3. Wewenang Komite Audit  
4. Rapat Komite Audit  
5. Pelaporan oneself Komite Audit  
6. Penanganan Pengaduan kepada Laporan Terkait Dugaan Pelanggaran Pelaporan Keuangan  
7. Masa Jabatan dan Honorarium Komite Audit

Piagam Komite secara berkala ditinjau dan diperbaharui agar tetap relevant dan mengikuti perkembangan,{serta tetap memperhatikan ketentuan dan perundang-undangan yang berlaku dan disetujui oleh Dewan Komisaris. Piagam tersebut dapat diakses oleh publik melalui situs resmi Perseroan.

# TUGAS, WEWENANG, DAN TANGGUNG JAWAB

Setiap anggota Komite Audit memegang tugas, wewenang, dan tanggung jawab seksuai dengan peraturan perundangundangan, terutama POJK No. 55/POJK.04/2015 dan Piagam Komite Audit. Komite Audit bertanggung jawab memberikan pendapat dan rekomendasi kepada Dewan Komisaris terkait hal-hal yang perlu diperhatikan. Detail dari tugas, wewenang, dan tanggung jawab tersebut dijelaskan sebagai berikut:

# Tugas dan Tanggung Jawab

1. Melakukan penelaahan atas informasi keuangan yang akan dikeluarkan Perseroanseperti laporan keuangan, projeksi, dan informasi keuangan lainnya.  
2. Melakukan penelaahan atas ketaatan Perseroan terhadap peraturan perundang-undangan baik di bidang Pasar Modal maupun lainnya yang berhubungan dengan kegiatan Perseroan.  
3. Memberikan rekomendasi kepada Dewan Komisaris mengenai penunjukan Akuntan Publik (AP) yang didasarkan pada independensi, ruang lingkup penugasan dan biayanya.  
4. Memberikan pendapat independen dalam hal terjadi perbedaan pendapat antara manajemen dan AP atas jasa yang diferikannya.  
5. Melakukan penelaahan atas pelaksanaan pemeriksan oleh auditor internal dan mengawasi pelaksanaan tindak lanjut oleh Direksi atas temuan auditor internal.

# AUDIT COMMITTEE CHARTER

The Board of Commissioners approved the Audit Committee Charter on August 1, 2013. The Audit Committee Charter contains guidelines for duties, responsibilities, and authorities that help the Audit Committee carry out its role in the Company. This charter provides guidance regarding the financial reporting process, implementation of corporate governance, audit and internal control, and other tasks.

The Audit Committee Charter incorporates the following aspects related to the Audit Committee:

1. Requirements for Audit Committee Membership  
2. Duties and Responsibilities of the Audit Committee  
3. Authority of the Audit Committee  
4. Audit Committee Meeting  
5. Reporting by the Audit Committee  
6. Complaint or Report Handling Related to Alleged Financial Reporting Violations  
7. Term of Office and Honorarium of Audit Committee

The Audit Committee Charter is periodically reviewed and updated to remain relevant and keep up with developments, as well as take into account applicable laws and regulations that are approved by the Board of Commissioners. The charter can be accessed by the public through the Company's official website.

# DUTIES, AUTHORITIES, AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Each member of the Audit Committee has duties, authorities, and responsibilities consistent with statutory regulations, particularly POJK No. 55/POJK.04/2015 and the Audit Committee Charter. Regarding issues that require attention, the Audit Committee offers opinions and suggestions to the Board of Commissioners. The following explanation provides details about the roles, responsibilities, and authority:

# Duties and Responsibilities

1. Review the financial information to be released by the Company such as financial statements, projections, and other financial information.  
2. Review the Company's compliance with the laws and regulations both in the Capital Market and other fields related to the Company's activities.

3. Provide recommendations to the Board of Commissioners regarding the appointment of a Public Accountant based on independence, the scope of the assignment and fees.  
4. Provide independent opinion in the event of discrepancies between management and the Public Accountant on the services they render.  
5. Review the audit by the internal auditor and oversee the implementation of the follow-up by the Board of Directors on the internal auditor findings.

6. Melaporkan kepada Dewan Komisaris berbagai risiko yang dihadapi Perseroan dan pelaksanaan manajemen risiko oleh Direksi.  
7. Melakukan penelaahan dan melaporkan kepada Dewan Komisaris atas pengaduan yang Berkaitan dengan proses akuntansi dan pelaporan keuangan Perseroan.  
8. Menjaga kerahasiaan dokumen, data dan informasi Perseroan.  
9. Melakukan penelaahan dan memberikan saran kepada Dewan Komisaris kerkait dengan adanya potensi benturan kepentingan Perseroan.  
10. Membuat, mengkaji dan memperbaharui Piagam Komite Audit.

# Wewenang

1. Komite Audit berwenang untuk membuatsson secara penuh, bebas dan tidak terbatas terhadap catatan, karyawan, dana, aset serta sumber daya Perseroan lainnya yang Berkaitan dengan pelaksanaan tugasnya.  
2. Dalam melaksanakan wewenang, Komite Audit wajib bekerja sama dengan karyawan termasuk Direksi dan pihak yang menjalankan fungsi audit internal, manajemen risiko dan Akuntan Publik erkaitugas dan tanggung jawab Komite Audit.  
3. Melibatkan pihak independen di luar anggota Komite Audit yang diperlukan untuk membantu pelaksanaan tugasnya (jika diperlukan).

# PENGANGKATAN DAN PEMBERHENTIAN KOMITE AUDIT

Komite Audit minimal terdiri dari 1 (satu) Komisaris Independen dan 2 (dua) anggota eksternal Perseroan. Sesuai POJK No. 55/POJK.04/2015,ASA tugas Komite Audit tidak boleh lebih lama dariASA jabatan Dewan Komisarisseperti yang tertera dalam Anggaran Dasar. Anggota Komite Audit dapat dipilih kembali oleh untuk 1 (satu)periode berikutnya.

Tanan Herwandi Antonius, yang juga menjadi sebagai Komisaris Independen, telah diangkat menjadi Ketua Komite Audit, sementara Lanny Bambang dan Thomas Johannes Angfendyunjada anggota Komite Audit. Proses pengangkatan tersebut telah dicatat melalui Surat Keputusan Dewan Komisaris tanggal 1 Agustus 2022 dan dilaksanakan dengan mematuhi peraturan perundangan. Informasi mengenai Komite Audit telah dilaporkan kepada Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK) dan dimuat di dalam situs web Bursa Efek Indonesia dan situs resmi Perseroan.

# KRITERIA KOMITE AUDIT

Kriteria Komite Audit telah ditentukan berdasarkan POJK No. 55/POJK.04/2015, yakni:

6. Report to the Board of Commissioners the various risks faced by the Company and the risk management implementation by the Board of Directors.  
7. Review and report to the Board of Commissioners on complaints relating to the Company's accounting and financial reporting processes.  
8. Keep the Company's documents, data and information confidential.  
9. Review and provide advice to the Board of Commissioners regarding the Company's potential conflict of interests.  
10. Create, review and update the Audit Committee Charter.

# Authorities

1. The Audit Committee has the authority to have full, free, and unlimited access to records, employees, funds, assets, and other Company resources related to the implementation of its duties.  
2. In exercising its authority, the Audit Committee is obliged to collaborate with employees, including the Board of Directors, and parties carrying out internal audit, risk management, and Public Accountant functions regarding the duties and responsibilities of the Audit Committee.  
3. Involve independent parties outside the Audit Committee members who are needed to assist in carrying out their duties (if necessary).

# APPOINTMENT AND DISMISSAL OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE

The Audit Committee consists of at least 1 (one) Independent Commissioner and 2 (two) external members of the Company. Under POJK No. 55/POJK.04/2015, the term of office of the Audit Committee can be as long as the term of office of the Board of Commissioners as stated in the Articles of Association. Audit Committee members can only be re-elected for 1 (one) subsequent period.

Tanan Herwandi Antonius, who also serves as an Independent Commissioner, has been appointed Chairman of the Audit Committee. At the same time, Lanny Bambang and Thomas Johannes Angfendy have become members of the Audit Committee. The appointment process has been recorded through the Decree of the Board of Commissioners dated August 1, 2022 and complies with statutory regulations. Information regarding the Audit Committee has been reported to the Financial Services Authority (OJK) and published on the Indonesia Stock Exchange website and the Company's official website.

# AUDIT COMMITTEE CRITERIA

The Audit Committee criteria have been determined based on POJK No. 55/POJK.04/2015, namely:

1. Memiliki integritas yang tinggi, kemampuan, pengetahuan dan pengalaman yang memadai sesuai dengan latar belakang pendidikannya,{serta mampuBERkomunikasi dengan baik.  
2. Salah seorang dari anggota Komite Audit memiliki latar belakang pendidikan akuntansi kepada keuangan.  
3. Memiliki pengetahunan yang@cukup untuk membraca dan memahami laporan keuangan, khususnya yang terkait dengan layanan jasa ata kegiatan usaha Perseroan, proses audit, manajemen risiko, dan peraturan perundang-undangan di bidang Pasar Modal serta peraturan perundang-undangan terkait lainnya.  
4. Wajib mematuhi kode etik Komite Audit yang ditetapkan oleh Perseroan.  
5. Bukan merupakan orang dalam Kantor Akuntan Publik, Kantor Konsultan Hukum, Kantor Jasa Penilai Publik ataupihak lain yang memberikan jasa assurance ataunon-assurance, jasa penilai dan/atau jasa konsultasi lain dalam 1 (satu) tahun terakhir pada Perseroan.  
6. Bukan merupakan Karyawan Kunci Perseroan dalam 1 (satu) tahun terakhir, kecuali Komisaris Independen.  
7. Tidak mempunyai saham pada Perseroan, baik langsung maupun tidak langsung.  
8. Dalam hal anggota Komite Audit memperoleh saham Perseroan baik langsung maupun tidak langsung akibat suatu peristiwa hukum, make saham tersebut wajib dialihkan kepada pihak lain dalam jangka waktu paling lama 6 (enam) bulan setelah diperolehnya saham tersebut.  
9. Tidak mempunyai hubungan afliliasi dengan Perseroan, Komisaris, Direksi, atau Pemegang Saham Utama Perseroan.  
10. Tidak memiliki hubungan usaha, baik langsung maupun tidak langsung yang Berkaitan dengan kegiatan usaha Perseroan.

# KOMPOSISI DAN NASA JABATAN KOMITE AUDIT

Hingga akhir tahun 2023, komposisi anggota Komite Audit adalah sebagai berikut:

1. Have high integrity, adequate ability, knowledge and experience relating to their educational background, as well as good communication skills.  
2. At least one of the Audit Committee members has to have finance or accounting educational background.  
3. Have sufficient knowledge to read and understand financial statements, particularly those related to the Company's services or business activities, audit processes, risk management, and legislation in the Capital Market and other relevant laws and regulations.  
4. Must comply with the Audit Committee code of conduct established by the Company.  
5. Not a person in the Public Accounting Firm, Law Firm, Public Appraisal Service or other parties providing assurance or non-assurance services, appraisal services and/or other consulting services in the last 1 (one) year for the Company.  
6. Has not been a key employee of the company for at least 1 (one) year, except Independent Commissioner.  
7. Has no share in the Company, either directly or indirectly.  
8. In the event that a member of the Audit Committee acquires the Company's shares both directly and indirectly as a result of a legal cases, those rights to shares must be transferred to another party within a period of 6 (six) months following the share acquisition.  
9. Has no affiliation with the Company, the Board of Commissioner, the Board of Directors, or shareholders of the Company.  
10. Does not have a business relationship, either directly or indirectly related to the Company's business activities.

She also served as Chair of the Audit Committee of PT Metropolitan Land Tbk from 2021 to 2022.

She has held concurrent positions as Independent Commissioner and Chair of the Audit Committee at PT Ciputra Residence and PT Asuransi Ciputra Indonesia (Ciputra Life) since 2013 and 2016, respectively. She has been a member of the Audit Committee of PT Metropolitan Kentjana Tbk since 2020.

# INDEPENDENSI KOMITE AUDIT

Ketua dan tersebut anggota Komite Audit telah餐廳 dengan independensinya dan tetap berkomitmen untuk mencunjung tinggi objektivitas dan profesionalisme dalam menuyangapaikan laporan kepada Dewan Komisaris. Perseroan menetapkan kriteria independensi yang harus dipatuhi, yaitu:

1. Anggota Komite Audit bukan merupakan pejabat eksekutif Kantor Akuntan Publik yang memberikan jasa audit dan/atau jasa non-audit kepada Perseroan dalam enam bulan terakhir sebelum penunjukanya sebagai anggota Komite Audit.  
2. Anggota Komite Audit juga tidak memiliki hubungan keuangan, tepengurusan, tepemilikan saham dan/atau hubungan kelarga dengan Dewan Komisaris, Direksi dan/atau Pemegang Saham Pengendali kepada hubungan dengan Perseroan, yang dapat mempengaruhi independensi anggota.

# RAPAT KOMITE AUDIT

# Kebijakan

Piagam Komite Audit memberi ketetapan(OPengenai pelaksanaan Rapat Komite Audit dengan ketentuan-ketentuan sebagai berikut:

1. Rapat Komite Audit wajib diadakan sekurang-kurangnya 3 (tiga) kali dalam 1 (satu) tahun.  
2. Rapat dipimpin oleh Ketua Komite Audit kepada Anggota Komite Audit yang paling senior, apabila Ketua Komite Audit berhalangan hadir.  
3. Rapat Komite Audit sekurang-kurangnya dihadiri oleh 2/3 (dua per tiga) dari jumlah anggota dan dapat dihadiri oleh Dewan Komisaris.  
4. Direksi atau Kepala Divisi Audit Internal dapat diundang untuk hadir pada Rapat Komite Audit biladipandang perlu.  
5. Keputusan rapat diambil atas persetujuan lebih dari  $1 / 2$  (satu per dua) jumlah anggota Komite Audit yang hadir.

6. Rapat Komite Audit sekurang-kurangnya membricarakan:

a. Kegiatan-kegiatan yang perlu dilakukan Komite Audit dalam rangka melaksanakan tugas dan fungsinya.  
b. Hasil penelaahan atas informasi yang telah diterima Komite Audit.

# INDEPENDENCE OF AUDIT COMMITTEE

The Chairman and all Audit Committee members have declared their independence and are committed to maintaining objectivity and professionalism when submitting reports to the Board of Commissioners. The Company sets the following independence standards that must be met:

1. The members of the Audit Committee are not an executive official in the Public Accountant Office that render audit services and/or non-audit services to the Company for the last six months prior to their appointment as members of the Audit Committee.  
2. The members of Audit Committee also do not have financial, management, share ownership and/or family relationship with the Board of Commissioners, the Board of Directors and/or Majority Shareholder or any relation with the Company that may affect their independency.

# AUDIT COMMITTEE MEETING

# Policy

The Audit Committee Charter stipulates the implementation of Audit Committee Meetings with the following provisions:

1. The Audit Committee must hold at least 3 (three) meetings in 1 (one) year.  
2. The meeting is led by Chairman of the Audit Committee. Should he/she be unable to attend a meeting, the most senior Audit Committee member will lead the meeting.  
3. The Audit Committee meeting must be attended by at least 2/3 (two thirds) of the committee members and may be attended by Board of Commissioners members.  
4. The Board of Directors or the Head of Internal Audit may be invited to attend Audit Committee meetings if deemed necessary.  
5. Decisions made by the committee must be approved by more than  $\frac{1}{2}$  (half) the number of attending Audit Committee members.  
6. The Audit Committee meeting must at least discuss:

a. Activities needed to be taken by the Audit Committee in order to carry out its duties and functions.  
b. Results of the review of the information has been received by the Audit Committee.

7. Hasil-hasil rapat Komite Audit dituangkan dalam suatu risalah rapat, termasuk apabila terdapat perbedaan pendapat (dissenting opinions), yang ditandatangani oleh seluruh anggota Komite Audit yang hadir dan disampaikan kepada Dewan Komisaris.

7. The results of the Audit Committee meeting are recorded in the minutes of the meeting, including if there are dissenting opinions, which are signed by all members of the Audit Committee present and submitted to the Board of Commissioners.

# IMPLEMENTATION OF AUDIT COMMITTEE DUTIES

Throughout the financial year 2023, the Audit Committee has performed its duties with the following details:

1. Performing audits related to financial information to be disseminated by the Company such as financial statements, projections, and other financial information.  
2. To review the Company's compliance with applicable laws in the capital market and other laws relating to the Company's business activities.  
3. Recommend to the Board of Commissioners the appointment of a public accountant based on independence, the scope of work, and fees.  
4. To provide an independent opinion when there is a difference of opinion between management and public accountants on the services provided.  
5. To oversee the implementation of the internal auditor's supervision and supervise the implementation of the Board of Directors follow-up on the internal auditor's findings.  
6. To report to the Board of Commissioners regarding the risks that the Company faces and the implementation of risk management by the Board of Directors.  
7. To review and report complaints relating to the accounting and financial reporting process to the Board of Commissioners.  
8. Maintain the confidentiality of Company documents, data, and information.  
9. To review and provide advice regarding potential conflicts of interest of the Company to the Board of Commissioners.  
10. To create, review, and update the Audit Committee Charter.

# Corporate Secretary

# DASAR HUKUM

Sekretaris Perusahaan memastikan keterbukaan informasi perusahaan dengan menjadi penghubung antar organ perusahaan dan pihak luar. Sekretaris Perusahaan bertanggung jawab untuk memastikan Bahwa perusahaan mematuhi peraturan yang berlaku ingin keterbukaan informasi,seperti POJK No.35/POJK.04/2014.

Sekretaris Perusahaan bertanggung jawab untuk mengelola administrasi perusahaan, termasuk mencatkan citra perusahaan, membina hubungan antar lembaga, memastikan kepadahan perusahaan terhadap peraturan pasar modal, dan melaksanakan tugas kesekretariatan,seperti SDM, hukum, governansi korporat, CSR, dan pembinaan UMKM.

Tulus Santosomenjabatsebagai Sekretaris Perusahaansejak tahun 2012 dan makeshift menjadi hingga tahun buku 2023 berdasarkan Surat Keputusan Direksi No. 085/CDCCKC/h/V/12-CTRA dan makeshift berlaku hingga tahun buku 2023. Beliau juga menjadi sebagai Direktur Perseroan dan tidak memiliki rangkap jabatan di Perusahaan Publik lain.

# TUGAS DAN TANGGUNG JAWAB SEKRETARIS PERUSAHAAN

Mengacu kepada Anggaran Dasar Perseroan dan POJK No. 35/POJK.04/2014, tugas dan tanggung jawab Sekretaris Perusahaan mencakup:

1. Memberikan informasi kepada publik khususnya pemegang saham mengenai kondisi Perseroan termasuk kegiatan ataupun transaksi material yang dapat mempengaruhi kondisi Perseroan.  
2. Mengikuti perkembangan pasar modal, khususnya peraturan-peraturan terkini yang berlaku di pasar modal.  
3. Bertindak tersebut mediator antara Perseroan dengan regulator, investor dan publikserta memastikan kepadahan Perseroan terhadap ketentuan dari para regulator.  
4. Memberikan masukan kepada Direksi Perseroan dalam hal kepadauhan terhadap peraturan perundangan yang berlaku.  
5. Mendukung Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris dalam hal pengawasan terhadap prerapan prinsip governansi korporat di Perseroan yang sesuai dengan peraturan perdang-undangan yang berlaku meliputi:

a. Keterbukaan informasi kepada masyarakat, termasuk ketersediaan informasi pada Situs Web Perseroan;

# LEGAL BASIS

The Corporate Secretary ensures the disclosure of company information by acting as a liaison between company organs and external parties. The Corporate Secretary is responsible for ensuring that the company complies with applicable regulations regarding information disclosure, such as POJK No. 35/POJK.04/2014.

The Corporate Secretary is responsible for managing company administration, including improving the company's image, fostering relationships between institutions, ensuring company compliance with capital market regulations, and carrying out secretarial duties, such as HR, legal, corporate governance, CSR, and developing MSMEs.

Tulus Santoso has served as Corporate Secretary since 2012 and will continue to serve until the 2023 financial year based on Directors' Decree No. 085/CDCCKC/h/V/12-CTRA, which is still valid until the financial year 2023. He also serves as Director of the Company and does not have concurrent positions in other Public Companies.

# DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES OF CORPORATE SECRETARY

According to the Company's Articles of Association and POJK No.35/POJK.04/2014, the duties and responsibilities of the Corporate Secretary include:

1. Providing information for public, especially the Shareholders related to the Company's condition including each activity or material transaction that may affect the Company's condition.  
2. Keep abreast of the capital market, specifically the updated prevailing capital market regulations.  
3. Acting as the liaison of the Company and regulators, investors and public as well as ensuring the Company to comply with the regulator's rules.  
4. Providing recommendation to the Board of Directors in terms of compliance with the prevailing rules and regulations.  
5. Assisting the Board of Directors and the Board of Commissionersinsupervising the GCGimplementation of the Company in accordance with the prevailing rules and regulations covering:  
a. Information disclosure to the public including the information availability on website;

b. Penyampaian laporan kepada Otoritas Jasa Keuangan dan Bursa Efek Indonesia tepat waktu;  
c. Penyelenggaraan dan dokumentasi Rapat Umum Pemegang Saham;  
d. Penyelenggaraan dan dokumentasi rapat Direksi dan/atau Dewan Komisaris; dan  
e. Pelaksanaan program orientasi bagi Direksi dan/ atau Dewan Komisaris.

6. Membuat laporan berkala(OP) mengenai pelaksanaan fungsi sekretaris perusahaan kepada Direksi dan ditembuskan kepada Dewan Komisaris sedikitnya sekali dalam setahun.  
7. Memelihara kerahasiaan dokumen, data dan informasi kecuali dalam rangka memenuhi kewajiban seksuai dengan peraturan. Perundang-undangan untuk ditentukan lain dalam peraturan perundang-undangan.

b. Submitting reports to Financial Services Authority and Indonesia Stock Exchange in timely manner;  
c. Organizing and documenting the General Meeting of Shareholders;  
d. Organizing and documenting Meetings of the Board of Directors and/or the Board of Commissioners; and  
e. Implementing orientation program for the Board of Directors and/or Board of Commissioners.

6. Preparing periodical reports at least once a year concerning the Corporate Secretary's function to the Board of Directors and carbon copied to the Board of Commissioners.  
7. Maintaining the confidentiality of documents, data and information, in exception for fulfilling the obligation in accordance with the rules or otherwise stated in regulation.

# SCOPE OF WORK

In conducting this function, the Internal Audit ensures that the Company's risk management, control, and management, designed and implemented by management, is adequate and functions well. The scope of the Company's Internal Audit duties following applicable regulations is as follows:

1. Risks have been reasonably identified and managed.  
2. Interactions with the manager taking place as it should be.  
3. Important information of financial, managerial, and operational is accurate, reliable, and punctual.  
4. Employees' actions are aligned with prevailing policies, standards, procedures, laws, and regulations.  
5. Resources acquired economically, used efficiently, and adequately protected.  
6. Program, plans and goals are able to achieve.  
7. Quality and continuous improvement preserved within the control of the Company.  
8. Prominent regulations and legislation which influence the Company has been known and are properly addressed.

Internal Audit duties are also closely related to problem-solving regarding management and operational issues the Company faces. In this way, the Company's Internal Audit is expected to improve the control, management, profitability, and image of the Company found during the audit process.

# Applied Risk Management in Company

The Company uses an Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) system to monitor the risks it faces. This system looks at risks from various points of view, both from within the company and from outside. That way, companies can manage risks comprehensively. This management system is implemented in all company business lines, including residential/housing, malls, hotels, apartments, offices, golf, water parks, and hospitals. By implementing this system, companies can minimize the negative impact of the risks they face. The Company also periodically updates its risk management framework by referring to ISO 31000 concerning Risk Management.

The Company has categorized frequently encountered risks into two main categories;

- Strategic Risk (reputation, regulatory compliance, financial, etc.)  
- Operational Risk (HR, information technology, business processes, SOPs, etc.)

The Company analyzes the risk profile using a bottom-up approach from business units and a top-down analysis from the Board of Directors. The implementation of risk profile mitigation is also monitored regularly.

The Company also focuses on developing Information Technology (IT) risk management. As companies increasingly rely on information technology (IT) in running their business, IT risk management has become essential for property companies to ensure that IT can be used safely, effectively, and efficiently.

To implement the risk management system, the Company established a Risk Management Unit (UMR) in each business unit with the following task details:

1. Assist management in building an ERM framework that suits the organizational structure and needs of each business unit;  
2. Play an important role in consolidating and reporting the main risks identified in various business units to the Board of Directors;  
3. Communicate strategic risks that are of concern to the Board of Directors to all business units; and  
4. Act as a facilitator in risk management by providing input on risk management, monitoring risk profiles, and reviewing the effectiveness of risk mitigation plans prepared by each business unit.

The Board of Commissioners is responsible for regularly monitoring the Company's risk management practices. The Board of Commissioners ensures that risk tolerance, strategies, goals, and objectives are all considered when creating risk management policies. Periodically reviewing risk management policies also helps to guarantee their effectiveness.

The purpose of evaluating the effectiveness of risk management is to assess the quality of the risk management process' design and implementation, risk level monitoring, and the Board of Directors' decision-making accuracy.

# STATEMENT OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND/OR BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS ON THE ADEQUACY OF THE RISK MANAGEMENT SYSTEM

The Board of Commissioners considers that the Company's risk management policy for 2023 is consistent with the company's goals, targets, strategies, and risk tolerance. In addition to guaranteeing that the impact and probability of risk have been evaluated and that suitable plans and strategies for risk mitigation are in place, risk management policies can also give early warning of material risks.

The Board of Commissioners also assesses that the implementation of the Company's risk management is following predetermined procedures, adequate, and under applicable laws and regulations. Based on the mitigation realization report, the Company does not experience significant and impactful risks in 2023. Every incidental event and minor risk that occurs in 2023 can be immediately addressed.

# RISKS ENCOUNTERED AND RISK MITIGATION EFFORTS

In carrying out its business activities, the Company faces various kinds of risks that can affect performance so they must be managed properly. The Company periodically and continuously identifies risks that may affect the Company's objectives and determines risk mitigation efforts to reduce and eliminate these risks. The Company also monitors the realization of risk mitigation and reports it every month to recalculate the residual risk value every 3 months. The effectiveness of risk management can be measured from the reduction in inherent risk (before mitigation) to the residual risk value (after mitigation).

Types of risks faced by the Company and mitigation efforts are as follows:

Risiko nilai tutkar mata uang adalah risiko di mana nilai wajar ata arus kas mata datang dari suatu instrumen keuanganan akan berfluktuasi akibat perubahan nilai tutkar mata uang asing. Perseroan dihadapkan dengan fluktuasi nilai tutkar terutama berasal dari kas dan setara kas.

# Upaya Mitigasi

Menciptakan pendanaan seimbang atas pinjaman dalam matauang asing dan makukanan hedging (lindung nilai) atas Hutang dalam matauang asing yang ada.

# 4. Risiko Suku Bunga

Risiko suku bunga adalah risiko di mana nilai wajar atas arus kas mata那段 yang dan suatu instrumen keuangan akan berfluktuasi akibat perubahan suku bunga pasar. Perseroan dihadapkan dengan risiko perubahan sukubunga pasar terutama kerait dengan utang bank yang dikenakan suku bunga mengambang.

# Upaya Mitigasi

Perseroan mengelola risiko suku bunga dengan cara berhati-hati dalam mengambil pinjaman bank dan membatasinya pada tingkat yang wajar seksuai dengan kebutuhan arus kas.

# 5. Risiko Kebocoran Data

Risiko kebocoran data adalah risiko di mana data pribadi ata rahasia perusahaan dibocorkan ke pihak yang tidak berwenang. Kebocoran data dapat说我yebabkan kerugian financier, reputasi, dan hukum bagi perusahaan.

credit risk faced by the Company originates from operating activities (mainly from the inability to pay debts on time).

# Mitigation

Seek funding sources with the lowest interest rates and maintain and manage the financial position to pay principal and interest on time.

# 2. Liquidity Risk

Liquidity risk is defined as the risk when the cash flow position of the Company indicates that the short-term revenue is not enough to cover the short-term expenditure.

# Mitigation

The Company actively monitors and maintains adequate cash levels to support its operations and overcome the impact of cash flow fluctuations. Periodic evaluations are carried out on projected and actual cash flows, including collectibility schedules and bank debt payment schedules, and continuing to check financial market conditions. This is done to maintain funding flexibility by ensuring the availability of committed credit facilities.

# 3. Foreign Currency Risk

Foreign currency risk is the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in foreign exchange rates. The Company's exposure to exchange rate fluctuations was primarily derived from cash and cash equivalents.

# Mitigation

Creating balanced funding for loans in foreign currency and hedging existing debt in foreign currency.

# 4. Interest Rate Risk

Interest rate risk is the risk that the fair value or future cash flows of a financial instrument will fluctuate because of changes in market interest rates. The Company is exposed to the risk of changes in market interest rates relating primarily to its bank loans with floating interest rates.

# Mitigation

The Company manages interest rate risk by carefully taking out bank loans and limiting them to a reasonable level per cash flow needs.

# 5. Data Breach Risk

Data leak risk is the risk of personal or confidential company data being leaked to unauthorized parties. Companies may suffer legal, financial, and reputational losses due to data breaches.

# Upaya Mitigasi

Membangun Infrastruktur Teknologi (IT) yang kokoh supaya terhindar dari pembajakan data, memuat duplikasi untuk cadangan (backup) atas data Perseroan secara Berkala dan membuat software anti virus supaya terhindar dari virus, oleh bahkan bila terkena virus为主线 data backup yang dapat digunakan.

# UPAYA MITIGASI RISIKO

Perseroan memiliki komitmen untuk mengurangi dan menghilangkan dampak risiko. Untuk itu, Perseroan terus menganalisis risiko-risiko yang ada dan menentukan langkah-langkah untuk mengurangi risiko tersebut. Perseroan juga memantau realisasi upaya mitigasi risiko tersebut setiap 3 (tiga) bulan. Pemantauan ini dilakukan untuk mengukur nilai risiko residual, yaitu risiko yang telah ada setelah upaya mitigasi dilakukan.

# Mitigation

Building a solid Infrastructure Technological (IT) to avoid data piracy, making duplicate backups of the Company's data regularly, and using anti-virus software to prevent viruses, or even if a virus is infected, backup data can still be used.

# RISK MITIGATION EFFORTS

The Company's goal is to minimize and completely eradicate risk. Because of this, the Company keeps evaluating current risks and figuring out how to make them smaller. Every 3 (three) months, The Company also keeps an eye on the success of risk mitigation measures. The purpose of this monitoring is to calculate the residual risk value or the risk that remains after mitigating actions have been taken.

# Sistem Pengendalian Internal Internal Control System

# SISTEM PENGENDALIAN KEUANGAN DAN OPERASIONAL

Perseroan menerapkan systemd pengendalian internalagogue langkah untuk mencatkan kinerja operasional, menerapkan prinsip-prinsip governansi korporat, dan mencapai visi serta misi perusahaan. Salah dapat systemd pengendalian yang Perseroan jalankan oleh sistemas pengendalian keuangan dan operasional. MelaluiSYSTEM ini, Perseroan berupaya kepada pengendalian aspek keuangan dan operasional Perseroan, termasuk memastikan keandalan pelaporan keuangan sesuai dengan prinsip-prinsip akuntansi yang berlaku. Upaya ini melibatkan participasi Dewan Komisaris, Direksi, dan manajemen lainnya.

# FINANCIAL AND OPERATIONAL CONTROL SYSTEM

The Company establishes an internal control system to improve operational performance, implement corporate governance principles, and achieve the company's vision and mission. The financial and operational control system is one of the control systems that the company uses. By using this system, the Company aims to maintain operational and financial control over its activities and guarantee the accuracy of its financial reporting in compliance with relevant accounting standards. The Board of Commissioners, Directors, and other management are involved in this endeavor.

Dewan Komisaris mengawasi;penerapan system pengendalian internal untuk memastikan olehSYSTEM tersebut berjalan dengan baik. Dewan Komisaris juga memberikan nasihat kepada Direksi terkait aspek keuang dan operasional, terutama dalam penyusunan laporan keuang dan pengendalian risiko.

# KESESUAIAN SISTEM PENGENDALIAN INTERNAL DENGAN COSO (INTERNAL CONTROL FRAMEWORK)

Perseroan merancang systemd pengendalian internal dengan membuat Internal COSO, sebelum kerangka kerja berstandar internasional yang membantu Perseroan secara konsisten mengidentifikasi, mencevaluasi, dan mengelola risiko. Selain itu, kerangka kerja ini berperan dalam mencatingkatkan kualitas laporan keuangan dan mendukung Perseroan dalam mencapai tujuan strategisnya.

Perseroan menciplementasikan COSO melalui 5 (lima) komponen inti yang dapat bersinergi dan mendukung tujuan bisnis Perseroan, di antaranya:

# 1. Control Environment

Komponen ini bertindak sebagai dasar Pengendalian Internal yang menyediakan arahan bagi Perseroan dan memberikan pengaruh akan kesadaran pengendalian dari individu yang ada di dalam Perseroan. Adapun faktor-faktor yang memengaruhi Control Environment antara lain adalah integritas dan nilai etik, komitmen terhadap kompetensi, Direksi dan Komite Audit, gaya manajemen dan gaya operasi, struktur organisi, pemberian wewenang dan tanggung jawab, praktik serta kebujanan SDM.

# 2. Monitoring

Merupakan suatu kegiatan yang berlangsung secara berkelanjutan, evaluasi secara terpisah oleh kombiniasi dari keduanya. Proses ini dilakukan untuk menentukan kualitas kinerja pengendalian internal yang mencakup penentuan desain dan operasi pengendalian tersebut waktu serta pengambilan tindakan perbaikan. Dalam hal ini pemantauan terhadap kegiatan Perseroan dilakukan oleh Audit Internal.

# 3. Risk Assessment

Membentuk suatu fondasi untuk mengidentifikasi pengelolaan risiko dan makukan analisis risiko yang relevant.

# 4. Control Activities

Memberikan suatu tingkat keyakinan akan adanya tinkakan yang diperlukan dalam rangka menanggulangi risiko.

# 5. Information and Communication

Menyediakan informasi yang relevant dans pelaporan keuangan yang meliputi sistem akuntansi yang berisi metode untuk membuat identifikasi, penggabungan,

The Board of Commissioners supervises the implementation of the internal control system to ensure that the system runs well. The Board of Commissioners also advises the Board of Directors regarding financial and operational aspects, especially in preparing financial reports and risk control.

# CONFORMITY OF INTERNAL CONTROL SYSTEM WITH COSO

The Company designs an internal control system by adopting the Internal COSO, an international standard framework that helps the Company consistently identify, evaluate, and manage risks. In addition, this framework plays a role in improving the quality of financial reports and supporting the Company in achieving its strategic objectives.

The Company implements COSO through 5 (five) core components to synergize and support the Company's business objectives, among others:

# 1. Control Environment

This component acts as the basis of the Internal Control that provides direction for the Company and gives effect to the control awareness of the individuals within the Company. The factors that influence the Control Environment include integrity and ethical values, commitment to competency, Board of Directors and Audit Committee, management style and operating style, organizational structure, granting authorities and responsibilities, practices and HR policies.

# 2. Monitoring

It is an on-going activity, a detached evaluation or a combination of them. This process is undertaken to determine the quality of internal control performance which includes the design and timely controlling operation and corrective action taking. In this case, the monitoring of the Company's activities is conducted by Internal Audit.

# 3. Risk Assessment

It establishes a foundation for identifying risk management and performing relevant risk analysis.

# 4. Control Activities

It provides a level of confidence in the existence of necessary actions in order to mitigate risk.

# 5. Information and Communication

It provides relevant information in financial reporting which includes an accounting system that contains methods for identifying, merging, analyzing,

analysis, klasifikasi, pescatatan dan pelaporan transaksi,<serta menjaga akuntabilitas aset dan reliabilitas. Informasi terkait harus diidentifikasi, terdeskripsi dan terkomunikasi dalam bentuk dan jangka waktu yang memungkinkan tiap individu melaksanan tanggung jawabnya.

# EVALUASI ATAS EFEKTIVITAS SISTEM PENGENDALIAN INTERNAL

Perseroan seksukan evaluasi atas efektivitasismelempengendalian internal melalui Divisi Internal Audit. Direksi Perseroan secara Berkala MENGEVALUASI efektivitas operasional sistem pengelolaan risiko, pengendalian internal, governansi, dan kepadahan. # EVALUATION ON THE EFFECTIVENESS OF INTERNAL CONTROL SYSTEM

The Company evaluates the effectiveness of its internal control system through the Internal Audit Division. This evaluation is conducted to provide assurance to the Board of Directors, shareholders, and stakeholders in general that the internal control system that has been implemented has achieved results according to the expected objectives. Furthermore, the results of the evaluation of the internal control system are outlined in the Audit Report which includes recommendations and suggestions for improvement to the President Director and the Board of Commissioners.

The Board of Directors regularly evaluates the operational effectiveness of risk management, internal control, governance, and compliance systems. The Board of Directors also ensures that the Company keeps abreast of changes in prevailing laws and regulations, both industry-related and general regulations. The Company has a system to ensure compliance with statutory and internal regulations.

# STATEMENT OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND/OR BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS ON THE ADEQUACY OF THE INTERNAL CONTROL SYSTEM

Based on assessments conducted by the Board of Directors and/or Board of Commissioners through the Audit Committee, the Company's internal control system in 2023 is considered adequate as reflected in the results of regular Audit Committee Meetings, which discuss audit findings that need to be/will be followed up by Management to overcome control weaknesses, or procedural violations that occur, so that in the future it is hoped that they will comply/follow the applicable provisions/rules.

# Kode Etik

# Code of Conduct

Perseroan entwicksi Kode Etik atop Kode Tata Laku tersebut panduan bagi Insan Perseroan dalam menjalankan tugas secara optimal, dengan tujuan mencatingkatkan professionnelisme secara berkesinambungan. Kode Tata Laku ini tidakanya berfungsi tersebut aturan yang melengkapi Peraturan Perusahaan, tetapi juga tersebut pedoman yang inginakomodasi kebutuhan para pemangku kepentingan.

Filosofi yang menjadi dalam Kode Etik adalah Integritas, dan keberHASIN implementasinya orang terbantung pada Kerja Sama dan Peran Serta dari seluruh Pengurus dan Kanyakan Perusahaan.

# Integritas

Menjunjung tinggi keujujuran, etika dan moral dalam bekerja untuk menciptakan iklim bekerja yang kondusif dan mengoptimalkan Corporate Value bagi Stakeholder seksuai dengan Visi - Misi Perusahaan.

# Kerja Sama

Bersemangat untuk saling menghormati, menghargai dalam menjalankan tugas dan saling memberikan bantuan untuk mendukung tercapainya produktivitas yang tinggi seksuai tujuan Perseroan.

One of the Company's commitments to implementing corporate governance principles, especially transparency, is that the Company uses the services of independent public accountants to carry out audits of financial reports. Public accountants are also responsible for ensuring that financial reports are reported following applicable accounting standards. The appointment of the Public Accounting Firm is carried out with reference to the Company's Articles of Association article 31 paragraph 7, the Decision of the GMS and the provisions of Article 13 paragraph 1 and 2 of the Financial Services Authority Regulation No. 13/POJK.03/2017 concerning the Use of Public Accountant Services and Public Accounting Firm in Financial Services Activities.

The GMS held on June 27, 2023, agreed to grant authority to the Board of Commissioners regarding the appointment of a public accountant, who then appointed Imelda & Rekan Public Accounting Firm and Mr. Alvin Ismanto (Public Accountant) as independent parties to audit the consolidated financial statements of the Company and its subsidiaries for the 2023 financial year.

The Company establishes a Code of Conduct to help employees perform their jobs as best they can, consistently raising the bar on professionalism. In addition to serving as guidelines that support the company regulations, this code of conduct also serves as a set of rules that consider stakeholders' needs.

The philosophy that forms the basis of the Code of Conduct is Integrity, and the success of its implementation is highly dependent on the Cooperation and Participation of all Company Management and Employees.

# Integrity

To uphold honesty, ethics, and morals to create a conducive working climate and optimize corporate value for stakeholders following the company's vision and mission

# Cooperation

Passionate about respecting each other, valuing each other in carrying out their duties, and providing mutual assistance to support the achievement of high productivity following the Company's goals.

# Peran Serta

Seluruh Pengurus dan Karyawan berperan serta dan berkontribusi menghasilkan yang terbaik dalam tugas dan tanggung jawabnya untuk mencapai tujuan Perseroan.

Perseroan seksukan sosialisasi Kode Etik kepada seluruh karyawannya, dimulai dari proses onboarding hingga staat karyawan mulai bekerja. Tujuannya adalah agar karyawan memahami nilai-nilai dan peraturan yang berlaku di perusahaan sehingga para karyawan dapat bekerja dan melaksanan aktivitas dengan menginepankan nilai-nilai dan peraturan yang telah ditetapkan. Selain itu, Kode Etik juga diunggah ke jaringan intranet Perseroan. Hal ini memudahkan karyawan untuk mengaksesnyaapan saja dan di mana saja.

Perseroan juga menerapkanSYSTEManksi sebagai;bentuk hukuman bagi karyawan yang tidak mematuhi Kode Etik.

# SANKSI

Perseroan telah mencapkan sanksi untuk pelanggaran kode etik yang disusun berdasarkan tingkatannya dengan mengaku kepada Peraturan Perseroan pasal 46, yaitu:

1. Menurut berat ringannya, sanksi terhadap pelanggaran tata tertib dan disiplin kerja dapat berupa:

a. Teguran lisan.  
b. Surat Peringatan Tertulis (I, II dan III).  
c. Ganti rugi.  
d. Pemutusan Hubungan Kerja (PHK).

2. Dalam hal dilakukanya pelanggaran atas tindakan lain yang nyata secara langsung maupun tidak langusing telah merugikan Perseroan,.make Perseroan berhak menjatuhkan sanksi yang berat atas terberat tanpa terikat pada urutan-urutan tersebut sanksi sebagaimana diuraikan pada ayat 1 (satu) di atas.

# Participation

All Management and Employees participate and contribute to produce the best in their duties and responsibilities to achieve the Company's goals.

# PRINCIPLES OF THE CODE OF CONDUCT

The Company's Code of Conduct is described in detail as follows:

a. Officers and Employees' Code of Conducts;  
b. Customers' Code of Conducts;  
c. Shareholders' Code of Conducts;  
d. Supplier's Code of Conducts;  
e. Community's Code of Conducts; and  
f. Employees Aspiration.

Every Ciputra Group management and employee is required to read, sign, and comply with the Code of Conduct at the time of the establishment of the employment contract.

# CODE OF CONDUCT SOCIALIZATION AND ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS

The Company socializes the Code of Conduct to all of its employees, beginning with the onboarding process and continuing until the employee starts work. The goal is for staff members to be aware of the rules and values governing the organization to prioritize these values and norms while working and performing their duties. In addition, the Code of Conduct is posted on the company's intranet network. This facilitates employee access, as they can do so from anywhere at any time.

In 2023, the Company has held various training and internal outreach activities regarding the Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct functions as a guide for each employee in carrying out their work. The Company also implements a sanctions system to punish employees who do not comply with the Code of Conduct.

# SANCTION

The Company has implemented sanctions for violations of the Code of Conduct, which is arranged by level concerning the Company's Regulation article 46, namely:

1. According to the severity, penalties for violation of work rules and discipline is as follows:

a. Verbal warning.  
b. Written Warning Letter (I, II and III).  
c. Compensation.  
d. Termination (PHK).

2. In the event of the infringement or any other action which obviously are directly and indirectly harm the company, then the company reserves the right to impose sanctions or heaviest weight without being linked to a sequence of sanctions as described in paragraph 1 (one) above.

3. Untuk pelanggaran-pelanggaran ringan yang dilakukan berulang kali walaupun sudah diberikan seguran lisan dan/atau peringatan tertulis, dapat dikenakan sanksi yang lebih berat tingkatannya.

Kebijakan pemberiansanksini tetah disusund danderapkan dengan mematuhi Peraturan Perseroan dan peraturan perundang-undangan yang berlaku.

# Budaya Perusahaan

# Corporate Culture

Integritas adalah “Ruh” atop sesuatu yang kekal yang ada dalam diri kami, sesuatu yang berkaitan dengan relasikita kepada Tuhan Yang Maha Esa. Oleh karena itu, pengertian Integritas adalah SQ (Spiritual Quotient) atop “the adaptive use of spiritual foundation to facilitate everyday problem solving and goal attainment” yaitu bagaimana nilai-nilai spiritual bersinar di dalam hidup kerja sehari-hari.

Sedangkan untuk "Tubuh" adalah Profesionalisme. Tubuh kita di mana di dalamnya terdapat oleh, orang penting untuk mewadahi segala upaya meraih keunggulan. Profesionalisme sekan IQ (Intelligent Quotient) manusia kepada kemampuan memecahkan masalah. Sebelum perusahaananya dapat memiliki operasi yang sehara bila para pengelolanya memiliki kecakapan memecahkan masalah yang terjadi setupi hari. Jadi Profesionalisme adalah hal yang harus dimiliki untuk biasa meraih keberHASIL dan hari ke hari.

Entrepreneurship adalah "Jiwa". Sesuatu yang ada dalam diri yang memberikan dorongan semangat dan membuat selalu bergerak ke depan ingin memiliki mataapan yang lebih baik. Inilah intisari Entrepreneurship yaitu makukan inovasi terus-menerus. Entrepreneurship digambarkanseperti EQ (Emotional Quotient) yang merupakan gabungan dari Personal Competence dan Social Competence. # KEPEMILIKAN SAHAM ANGGOTA DEWAN KOMISARIS DAN DIREKSI

Sesuai POJK No. 11/POJK.04/2017 tantalng Laporan Kepemilikan atau Setiap Perubahan Kepemilikan Saham Perusahaan Terbuka ("POJK 11/2017"), anggota Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi wajib menginformasikan dan melaporkan kepemilikan saham dan/atau setiap perubahan kepemilikan saham, langsung maupun tidak langsung kepada Perseroan dengan;tenggat waktu yaitu:

1. Pemberitahuan kepada Perseroan selambat-lambatnya 3 hari kerja; dan  
2. Pelaporan kepada OJK selambat-lambatnya 10 hari.

Selama tahun 2023, Direksi dan Dewan Komisaris Perseroan tidak dalamukan transaksi pembelian oleh penjalan saham, baik secara langsung maupun tidak langsung. Informasi terkitak kepemilikan saham oleh Dewan Komisaris dan Direksi dapat ditemukan pada Bab Profil Perusahaan, halaman 58.

# SHARE OWNERSHIP OF MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF COMMISSIONERS AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS

Following POJK No. 11/POJK.04/2017 concerning Ownership Reports or Any Changes in Share Ownership of Public Companies ("POJK 11/2017"), members of the Board of Commissioners and Directors are required to inform and report share ownership and/or any changes in share ownership, directly or indirectly to The Company's deadlines are:

1. Notification to the Company no later than 3 working days; and  
2. Reporting to OJK no later than 10 days.

During 2023, the Company's Board of Directors and Board of Commissioners did not carry out share purchase or sale transactions, either directly or indirectly. Information on share ownership by the Board of Commissioners and Directors is available in the Company Profile Chapter, page 58.

# Sistem Pelaporan Pelanggaran Whistleblowing System

Perseroan telah menerapkan Whistleblowing System-Sebagai bagian integral dari praktik governansi korporat untuk mencapatkan transparansi dan akuntabilitas. Sistem ini juga merupakan komponen utama dari Anti-Fraud Management System Perseroan. Dengan mekanisme pelaporan, proses penanganan, dan umpan balik kepada manajemen dan pelapor, Whistleblowing System dijalankan oleh Tim Investigasi Pengaduan Pelanggaran, memiliki tanggung jawab untuk melanjutkan penyelidikan atas indikasi pelanggaran jika diperlukan, atau merujuknya ke pihak Manajemen Proyekteringkaitkomplain projek funga ditangani lebih lanjut.

Penerapan Whistleblowing System bertujuan untuk mendorong pelaporan perilaku yang melanggar peraturan perundang-undangan atasidak etis, memastikan adanya saluran yang aman dan terpercaya bagi para pelapor.

Sebagai bagian dari kebikan Whistleblowing System, Perseroan menjamin oleh pelapor akan dilindungi dari segala tindakan ancaman, diskriminasi, intimidasi, atau tingdakan merugikan lainnya yang mungkin pelapor akan selama telah setelah menjalankan proses pelaporan. Kebikan ini memastikan oleh pelaparan yang diterima akan ditangani

The Company has implemented a Whistleblowing System as an integral part of corporate governance practices to increase transparency and accountability. This system is also the main component of the Company's Anti-Fraud Management System. With a reporting mechanism, handling process, and feedback to management and whistleblowers, the Whistleblowing System is run by the Violation Complaint Investigation Team, which responsible for continuing investigations into indications of violations if necessary, referring them to Project Management regarding project complaints for further follow-up.

The Whistleblowing System's implementation aims to encourage reporting of unethical or illegal behavior while also providing whistleblowers with a safe and trustworthy channel.

As part of the Whistleblowing System policy, the Company guarantees that whistleblowers will be protected from any threats, discrimination, intimidation, or other detrimental actions that whistleblowers may experience during or after the reporting process. This policy ensures that every report received will be handled transparently and fairly,

# Anti-Corruption Policy

Perseroan bergomitmen untuk menjalankan bisnis yang jujur, etis, dan putuh hukum. Untuk itu, Perseroan selelu bertindak profesional, adil, dan berintegritas dalam menjalankan kesepakatan dan hubungan bisnis dengan mitra dan pemasok. Perseroan tidak akan memberikan toleransi terhadap segala pentuk penyuapan atas korupsi, baik secara langsung maupun tidak langsung, yang melibatkan siapa pun yang terkait dengan perusahaan.

Sebagai pentuk komitmen dalam memberantas korupsi, Perseroan memiliki strategi pencegahan yang dirancang untuk membuat berbagai praktik korupsi,seperti suap, gratifikasi, dan balas jasa.Strategi tersebut melibatkan peran serta karyawan dan pihak eksternal. Karyawan dan pihak eksternal dapat melaporkan tindakan korupsi yang terjadi di lingkungan Perseroan melalui email, QR code,atak WhatsApp. Perseroan juga mencevaluasi secara bergala kebjikan antikorupsi untuk memastikan kepada kebjikan tersebut,buta dilakukan secara efektif.

# NUMBER OF COMPLAINTS IN 2023

The results of the follow-up by the relevant parties indicate that each case can be resolved entirely and properly.

The Company is committed to running an honest, ethical, law-abiding business. For this reason, the Company always acts professionally, reasonably, and with integrity in carrying out agreements and business relationships with partners and suppliers. The Company will not tolerate any form of bribery or corruption, directly or indirectly, involving anyone associated with the company.

Both external parties and employees are involved in this strategy. Employees and outside parties can report corruption within the company via WhatsApp, QR codes, or email. To ensure that anti-corruption policies are carried out successfully, the company also evaluates them regularly.

# PELATIHAN/SOSIALISASI ANTI KORUPSI

Dalam upaya pencegahan korupsi, Perseroan secara rutin menyelenggarakan sosialisasi kepada seluruh karyawan untuk mencaringkatkan pemahaman terhadap tindakan korupsi. Sosialisasi ini bertujuan untuk mencarkan pentingnya nilai Integritas, Profesionalisme, dan Entrepreneurship (IPE) sebagai landasan etika dalam bekerja. Selain itu, Perseroan juga mengoptimalkan identifikasi kasus fraud dengan membuat pelatihan khusus bagi anggota Divisi Audit Internal. Tindakan ini diambil untuk memastikan Bahwa tim internal MEMILI pengetahuan dan keterampilan yang diperlukan dalam menghadapi potensi kasus kecurangan.

# ANTI-CORRUPTION TRAINING/ SOCIALIZATION

To prevent corruption, the Company conducts regular outreach to all employees to increase awareness of corrupt practices. This socialization aims to underline the significance of Integrity, Professionalism, and Entrepreneurship (IPE) values as the cornerstone of work ethics. In addition, the Company holds specialized training sessions for Internal Audit Division personnel to enhance the identification of fraud cases. This is done to ensure that the internal team is equipped with the knowledge and abilities needed to handle possible fraud cases.

# Kebijakan Perlindungan Data Pribadi Personal Data Protection Policy

Dalam rangka memastikan kepadauhan terhadap Undang-Undang No. 27 tahun 2022 tersebut Perlindungan Data Pribadi, pada tahun 2023 Perseroan telah mengeluarkan kebujakan Perlindungan Data Pribadi yang terkait dengan rangkaian proses pengolahan data pribadi di lingkungan Perseroan. Perseroan Berkomitmen untuk menjangin penggunaan dan pengungkapan data pribadinya akan dilakukan dengan persetujuan pribadi yang bersangkutan, seksuali untuk penyediaan layanan dan pengolahan data dan transaksi yang terkait dalam menjalankan aktivitas Perseroan serta untuk mendukung proses penegakan hukum. Dalam hal terjadi kebocoran data yang disebabkan oleh hal di luar Kendali Perseroan dan berdampak negatif secara material terhadap kegiatan masyarakat,.make Perseroan akan segera mencinformasikannya kepada pemilik data pribadi dan mengupayakan penanganan dan pemulihannya. Perseroan juga akan melakukan evaluasi berkala atas kebujakan ini demi memastikan kepadauhan terhadap perubahan perundang-undangan maupun kebutuhan kegiatan usaha sehingga dapat dilakukan pembaharuan sewaktu-waku.

To ensure compliance with Law No. 27 of 2022 concerning Personal Data Protection, in 2023, the Company issued a Personal Data Protection policy related to a series of personal data processing processes within the Company. The Company is committed to ensuring that the use and disclosure of personal data will only be carried out with the individual consent of the person concerned, except for providing services and data processing and transactions related to carrying out the Company's activities and supporting law enforcement processes. In the event of a data leak caused by things beyond the Company's control and having a material adverse impact on community activities, the Company will immediately inform the owner of the personal data and make efforts to handle and recover it. The Company will also regularly evaluate this policy to ensure compliance with changes in legislation and business activity needs so that it can be updated at any time.

# Opini

Kami telah mengaudit laporan keuangan konsolidasian PT Ciputra Development Tbk dan entitas anaknya ("Grup"), yang terdiri dari laporan posisi keuangan konsolidasian tanggal 31 Desember 2023, serta laporan laba rugi dan penghasilan komprehensif lain konsolidasian, laporan perubahan ekuitas konsolidasian, dan laporan arus kas konsolidasian untuk tahun yang berakhir pada tanggal tersebut, serta catatan atas laporan keuangan konsolidasian, termasuk informasi kebjikan akuntansi material.

Menurut opini kami, laporan keuangan konsolidasian terlampir menjadi sejakan untuk wajar, dalam semua hal yang material, posisi keuangan konsolidasian Grup tanggal 31 Desember 2023, serta kinerja keuangan konsolidasian dan arus kas konsolidasiannya untuk tahun yang berakhir pada tanggal tersebut, seksuai dengan Standar Akuntansi Keuangan di Indonesia.

# Basis Opini

Kami melaksanakan audit kami berdasarkan Standar Audit yang ditetapkan oleh Institut Akuntan Publik Indonesia. Tanggung jawab kami menurut standar tersebut diuraikan lebih lanjut dalam paragraf Tanggung Jawab Auditor terhadap Audit atas Laporan Keuangan Konsolidasian pada laporan kami. Kami independen terhadap Grup bergasarkan ketentuan etika yang relevant dalam audit kami atas laporan keuangan konsolidasian di Indonesia, dan kami telah memenuhi tanggung jawab etika lainnya bergasarkan ketentuan tersebut. Kami yakin Bahwa bukti audit yang telah kami peroleh adalah@cukup dan的前提下 menyediakan suatu basis bagi opini audit kami.

# Opinion

We have audited the consolidated financial statements of PT Ciputra Development Tbk and its subsidiaries (the "Group"), which comprise the consolidated statement of financial position as at December 31, 2023, and the consolidated statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, consolidated statement of changes in equity and consolidated statement of cash flows for the year then ended, and notes to the consolidated financial statements, including material accounting policy information.

In our opinion, the accompanying consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated financial position of the Group as at December 31, 2023, and its consolidated financial performance and its consolidated cash flows for the year then ended in accordance with Indonesian Financial Accounting Standards.

# Basis for Opinion

We conducted our audit in accordance with Standards on Auditing established by the Indonesian Institute of Certified Public Accountants. Our responsibilities under those standards are further described in the Auditor's Responsibilities for the Audit of the Consolidated Financial Statements paragraph of our report. We are independent of the Group in accordance with the ethical requirements that are relevant to our audit of the consolidated financial statements in Indonesia, and we have fulfilled our other ethical responsibilities in accordance with these requirements. We believe that the audit evidence we have obtained is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our opinion.

# Imelda & Rekan

# Hal Audit Utama

Hal audit utama adalah hal-hal yang,menurut pertimbangan profesionalkami,merupakan hal yang paling signifikan dalam audit kami atas lapsoran keuangan konsolidasian periodekini.Hal-hal tersebut disampaikan dalam konteks audit kami atas lapsoran keuangan konsolidasian secara keseluruhan,dandalam merumuskan opini kami atas lapsoran keuangan konsolidasian terkait, kami tidak mencatatakan suatu opini terpisah atas hal audit utama tersebut.

Cadangan atas penurunan nilai persediaan (aset pengembangan real estat - tanah, rumah hunian dan ruko dalam penyelesaian, apartemen dalam penyelesaian dan kantor dalam penyelesaian)

Pada tanggal 31 Desember 2023, Grup memiliki aset pengembangan real estat, yang diklasifikasikan sebagai persediaan, sebesar Rp 12.088.020 juta yang mencakup  $27\%$  dari jumiah aset konsolidasian Grup.

Persediaan dinyatakansbesar nilai yang lebih rendah antara biaya perolehan ataunnila realisasi neto.Nilai realisasi neto untukaset pengembangan real estat ditentukan berdasarkan estimasi kepada jual dikurangi dengan taksiran biaya penyelesaan konstruksi.

Kami menci dentifikasi cadangan atas penurunan nilai persediaan sebagai hal audit utama karena estimasi nilai realisasi neto melibatkan pertimbangan signifikan manajemen terhadap variabel utama dan kondisi pasar.

Pengungkapan Grup mengenai persediaan disajikan dalam Catatan 8 atas laporan keuang konsolidasian.

Bagaimana hal ini ditangani dalam audit

Kami melaksanakan prosedur audit berikut sehubungan dengan cadangan atas penurunan nilai persediaan:

- Memperoleh pemahaman atas proses dan pengendalian yang relevantkan asadangan atas penurunan nilai aset pengembangan real estat untuk mengevaluasi rancangan dan implementasi dari pengendalian internal manajemen yang relevant.  
- Menanyakan kepada manajemen mengenai proses penentuan nilai realisi neto asset pengembangan real estat, yang sebagian tersebut terdiri dari estimasiarga jual dan taksiran biaya penyelesaian konstruksi.  
- Membandingkan estimasi dengan jual setelah mempertimbangkan diskon dan penyesuaian hargain, dengan harga penjalan aktual dari transaksi terkini properti serupa yang telah sebelum dibangun.  
- Berdiskusi dengan manajer projek untuk menilai kewajaran perkiraan biaya penyelesaian dan mengatkan asumsi dasar yang dibuat terhadap projek serupa yang telah sebelum dibangun.

# Key Audit Matters

Key audit matters are those matters that, in our professional judgment, were of most significance in our audit of the consolidated financial statements of the current period. These matters were addressed in the context of our audit of the consolidated financial statements as a whole, and in forming our opinion thereon, and we do not provide a separate opinion on these matters.

Allowance for decline in value of inventories (real estate development assets - land, residential and shophouses under construction, apartments under construction and offices under construction)

As at December 31, 2023, the Group has real estate development assets, which are classified as inventories, amounting to Rp 12,088,020 million which accounted for approximately  $27\%$  of the Group's total consolidated assets.

Inventories are stated at the lower of cost and net realizable value. Net realizable value of real estate development assets is assessed with reference to estimated selling price less estimated cost to complete the construction.

We identified the allowance for decline in value of inventories as a key audit matter as the estimation of the net realizable value involves significant management judgement on key variables and market conditions.

The Group's disclosures on inventories are set out in Note 8 to the consolidated financial statements.

How the matter was addressed in the audit

We performed the following audit procedures in relation to the allowance for decline in value of inventories:

- Obtained an understanding of processes and relevant controls over the allowance for the decline in value of real estate development assets and evaluated the design and implementation of the relevant management's internal controls.  
- Inquired with management on the process in determining the net realizable value of real estate development assets, which comprise mainly the estimated selling price and the estimated cost to complete the construction.  
- Compared the estimated selling price after considering discounts and other price adjustments, to actual selling prices from recent transactions of similar completed properties.  
- Inquired with the project managers to assess the reasonableness of the estimated costs to complete the construction and corroborate the underlying assumptions made with our understanding of similar projects which have been completed.

# Imelda & Rekan

Melakukan pengujian retrospektif dengan membrandingkan perkiraan biaya penyelesaian dari manajemen dan julum biaya aktual berdasarkan sampel.  
- Menilai ketepatan pengungkapan terkait dalam laporan keuangan konsolidasian.

Laporan keuang konsolidasian Grup untuk tahun yang berakhir pada tanggal 31 Desember 2022 diaudit oleh auditor independen lain yang menyatakapan opini tanpa modifikasian ataslaporan keuangkonsolidasian tersebut pada tanggal 30 Maret 2023.

Opini kami atas laporan keuangan konsolidasian tidak mencakup informasi lain, dan oleh karena itu, kami tidak akan menyatakan;bentuk keyakinan apapun atas informasi lain tersebut.

Sehubungan dengan audit kami atas laporan keuangkan konsolidasian, tanggung jawab kami adalah untuk membraca informasi lain yang teridentifikasi di atas, jika tersedia dan, dalam melaksanakannya, mempertimbangkan kepada informasi lain mengandung ketidakkonsistensian material dengan laporan keuangan konsolidasian ataupemahaman yang kami peroleh selama audit, ataumengandung kesalahanan penyajian material.

Ketika kami membraca laporan tahunan, jika kami mencypulkan telah terdapat suatu kesalahan penyajian material di dalamnya, kami diharuskan untuk mengomunikasikan hal tersebut kepada pihak yang bertanggung jawab atas tata kelola dan mengambil tindakan yang tepat seksuai dengan Standar Audit yang ditetapkan oleh Institut Akuntan Publik Indonesia.

# Tanggung Jawab Manajemen dan Pihak yang Bertanggung Jawab atas Tata Kelola terhadap Laporan Keuangan Konsolidasian

Manajemen bertanggung jawab atas penyusunan dan penyajian wajar laporan keuangan konsolidasian tersebut sesuai dengan Standar Akuntansi Keuangan di Indonesia, dan atas pengendalian internal yang dianggap perlu oleh manajemen untuk memungkinkan penyusunan laporan keuangan konsolidasian yang bebas dari kesalahan penyajian material, baik yang disebabkan oleh kecurangan maupun kesalahan.

- Performed retrospective testing by comparing management's estimated cost to complete the construction and the actual costs incurred on a sampling basis.  
Assessed the appropriateness of the related disclosures in the consolidated financial statements.

# Other Matter

# Other Information

Management is responsible for the other information. The other information comprises the information included in the annual report, but does not include the consolidated financial statements and our auditor's report thereon. The annual report is expected to be made available to us after the date of this auditor's report.

In connection with our audit of the consolidated financial statements, our responsibility is to read the other information identified above when it becomes available and, in doing so, consider whether the other information is materially inconsistent with the consolidated financial statements or our knowledge obtained in the audit, or otherwise appears to be materially misstated.

When we read the annual report, if we conclude that there is a material misstatement therein, we are required to communicate the matter to those charged with governance and take appropriate actions in accordance with Standards on Auditing established by the Indonesian Institute of Certified Public Accountants.

# Responsibilities of Management and Those Charged with Governance for the Consolidated Financial Statements

Management is responsible for the preparation and fair presentation of the consolidated financial statements in accordance with Indonesian Financial Accounting Standards, and for such internal control as management determines is necessary to enable the preparation of consolidated financial statements that are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error.

# Imelda & Rekan

Dalam penyusunan laporan keuangan konsolidasian, manajemen bertanggung jawab untuk menilai kemampuan Grup dalam mempertahankan kelangsungan usahanya, mengungkapkan, sesuai dengan kondisinya, hal-hal yang berkaitan dengan kelangsungan usaha, dan meng gunakan basis akuntansi kelangsungan usaha, kecuali manajemen memiliki intensi untuk melikuidasi Grup padau menghentikan operasi, atasidak memiliki alternatif yang realistis selain melaksanakannya.

Pihak yang bertanggung jawab atas tata kelola bertanggung jawab untuk mengawasi proses pelaporan keuangan Grup.

# Tanggung Jawab Auditor terhadap Audit atas Laporan Keuangan Konsolidasian

Tujuan kami adalah untuk memperoleh keyakinan memadaitentangapakahlaporankeuangankonsolidasian secarakeseluruhanbebasdarikesalahannenyajian material,baik yang disebabkanolehkecuranganmaupun kesalahan,danuntukmenerbitkanlaporanauditoryang mencakup opini kami. Sebagai bagian dari suatu audit berdasarkan Standar Audit, kami menerapkan pertimbangan profesional dan mempertahankan skeptisisme profesional selama audit. Kami juga:

- Mengidentifikasi dan menilai risiko kesalahan penyajian material dalam laporan keuangan konsolidasian, baik yang disebabkan oleh kecurangan maupun kesalahan, mendesain dan melaksanakan prosedur audit yang responsif terhadap risiko tersebut, serta memperoleh bukti audit yang@cukup dan kepada untuk menyediakan basis bagi opini kami. Risiko tidak terdeteksinya kesalahan penyajian material yang disebabkan oleh kecurangan lebih tinggi dari yang disebabkan oleh kesalahan, karena kecurangan dapat melibatkan kolusi, pemalsuan, penghilangan secara mengaja, pernyataan salah, ata Pengabalan pengendalian internal.

In preparing the consolidated financial statements, management is responsible for assessing the Group's ability to continue as a going concern, disclosing, as applicable, matters related to going concern and using the going concern basis of accounting unless management either intends to liquidate the Group or to cease operations, or has no realistic alternative but to do so.

Those charged with governance are responsible for overseeing the Group's financial reporting process.

# Auditor's Responsibilities for the Audit of the Consolidated Financial Statements

Our objectives are to obtain reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated financial statements as a whole are free from material misstatement, whether due to fraud or error, and to issue an auditor's report that includes our opinion. Reasonable assurance is a high level of assurance, but is not a guarantee that an audit conducted in accordance with Standards on Auditing will always detect a material misstatement when it exists. Misstatements can arise from fraud or error and are considered material if, individually or in the aggregate, they could reasonably be expected to influence the economic decisions of users taken on the basis of these consolidated financial statements.

As part of an audit in accordance with Standards on Auditing, we exercise professional judgment and maintain professional skepticism throughout the audit. We also:

Identify and assess the risks of material misstatement of the consolidated financial statements, whether due to fraud or error, design and perform audit procedures responsive to those risks, and obtain audit evidence that is sufficient and appropriate to provide a basis for our opinion. The risk of not detecting a material misstatement resulting from fraud is higher than for one resulting from error, as fraud may involve collusion, forgery, intentional omissions, misrepresentations, or the override of internal control.  
- Obtain an understanding of internal control relevant to the audit in order to design audit procedures that are appropriate in the circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the effectiveness of the Group's internal control.

# Imelda & Rekan

- Mengevaluasi ketepatan kebijakan akuntansi yang digunakan serta kewajaran estimasi akuntansi dan pengungkapan terkait yang dibuat oleh manajemen.  
- Menyimpulkan ketepatan penggunaan basis akuntansi kelangsungan usaha oleh manajemen dan, berdasarkan bukti audit yang dipereleh, apakah terdapat suatu ketidakpastian material yang terkait dengan peristiwa untuk kondisi yang dapat mencywabekkan keraguan signifikan atas kemampuan Grup untuk mempertahankan kelangsungan usahanya. Ketika kami mencywabekkan kepada suatu ketidakpastian material, kami diharuskan untuk menarik perhatian dalam laporan auditor kami kepengungkapan terkait dalam laporan keuangangan konsolidasian untuk, jika pengungkapan tersebut被淘汰 memadai, harus menentukan apakah perilu untuk memodifikasi opini kami.
